book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.description: A classic novel depicting the decadence and disillusionment of the Jazz Age.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.author: Harper Lee
book.description: A powerful story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South.

book.author: George Orwell
book.description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society where individualism is suppressed.

book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.description: A classic love story featuring the independent-minded Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

book.title: The Catcher in the Rye
book.author: J.D. Salinger
book.description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disaffected teenager.

book.title: Brave New World
book.author: Aldous Huxley
book.description: A futuristic novel exploring a society where people are genetically engineered and controlled.

book.title: The Lord of the Rings
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: An epic fantasy trilogy following the journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

book.title: Crime and Punishment
book.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
book.description: A psychological novel exploring the moral and psychological dilemmas faced by its protagonist.

book.title: To the Lighthouse
book.author: Virginia Woolf
book.description: A modernist novel that delves into the inner thoughts and experiences of its characters.

book.title: The Hobbit
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: A fantasy adventure novel featuring Bilbo Baggins and his journey to reclaim the Lonely Mountain.
